snippet: White House aides said President Obama would sign an executive order on Friday morning directing federal agencies to make it easier for states to build resilience against storms.
abstract: White House is expected to take steps to help society adapt to global warming, focusing on climate shifts while trying to cut greenhouse gas emissions; aides say Pres Obama will sign executive order directing federal agencies to make it easier for states to build resilience against storms and droughts.
lead_paragraph: White House aides said President Obama would sign an executive order on Friday morning directing federal agencies to make it easier for states to build resilience against storms.

headline.main: White House Will Focus on Climate Shifts While Trying to Cut Greenhouse Gases
headline.print_headline: White House Will Focus on Climate Shifts While Trying to Cut Greenhouse Gases
